revised_title: A New Model for Nuclear Matter: The Mesic Fluid and Nucleonic Interactions
tldr: The author proposes a new model for nuclear matter, in which the meson field condenses into an incompressible fluid, and nucleons are confined to its interior by strong interactions with the fluid. This model explains the different values obtained for nuclear radii from electromagnetic and specifically nuclear interactions and provides a qualitative understanding of nuclear structure and collective features.
